results.title: The Boys from Brazil
results.creator_credit: Franklin J. Schaffner, Stanley O'Toole, Martin Richards, Fox and Circle Productions
results.brief_description: A terrifying thriller based on the best-selling novel by Ira Levin. Living in South America, Dr. Josef Mengele, (Gregory Peck) gathers a group of former Nazis in his plan to clone Hitler. Barry Kohler, (Steve Guttenburg), informs famed Nazi hunter Ezra Lieberman, (Laurence Olivier). Kohler’s murder incites Lieberman to investigate, and he begins to unravel a conspiracy which leads to Mengele. Mengele has cloned 94 Hitlers, and is killing their fathers in order to simulate Hitler’s own youth. Suddenly, the terrifying extent of Mengele’s plan is revealed. Also stars James Mason, Denholm Elliot and Lilli Palmer.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Franklin J. Schaffner, Stanley O’Toole, Martin Richards, Fox and Circle Productions

results.title: Warming by the devil's fire
results.creator_credit: Charles Burnett, Alex Gibney, Margaret Bodde, Reverse Angle International and Vulcan (US)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Blues Collection = Martin Scorsese presents The Blues a musical journey [DVD]”.
Part of Martin Scorsese’s “The Blues Collection”. Kidnapped by Uncle Buddy, on his way to be saved from the devil by being baptised, a young 11 year-old boy gets a life education on exactly what it is he is going to be ‘saved’ from. Through a re-telling of this young boy’s journey travelling the Deep South, his education becomes the viewers’ with a narration (by Carl Lumbly) of the boy as an adult recalling this past he will never forget. The history of the African American musician is his lesson, starting out in New Orleans and the blues music that stemmed from early 1900 to the 1940s turns into, as the director says, a ‘story that gives you the impression of the blues’. Inserted in the ‘educational’ narrative is a combination of archival footage of the period, original performances and stills. The influence of the church and gospel music is covered and the work also includes details of female performers whose powerful music and voices transcend time and place, such as Bessie Smith, Victoria Spivey, Ma Rainey, Dinah Washington and Sister Rosetta Thorpe. Others featured include Willie Dixon, Sonny Boy Williamson, Son House, John Lee Hooker and Muddy Waters amongst many others. Cast includes Tommy Redmond Hicks and Nathaniel Lee Jr. with an original score by Stephen James Taylor.

results.title: The Big gamble
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Australians per capita are the biggest gamblers in the world. This program takes a valuable look at how, when, why and where Australians love to have a bet.

results.title: Child at the centre
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
In this frank and uninhibited documentary parents and childcare workers talk candidly about that widely used but rarely understood term - multiculturalism. Rather than separate and draw attention to differences, the childcare experts interviewed here create an environment where cultures fuse and blend. “The Child at the Centre” shows us a rich slice of Australia, very much a ‘hands on’ approach to early childhood education that benefits all children whatever their cultural background.

results.title: Piano blues
results.creator_credit: Clint Eastwood, Alex Gibney, Margaret Bodde, Reverse Angle International and Vulcan (US)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Blues Collection = Martin Scorsese presents The Blues a musical journey [DVD]”.
Part of Martin Scorsese’s “The Blues Collection”. An intimate series of interviews with some of the big names in piano blues music in America with director, and fellow pianist, Clint Eastwood. Starting out with Ray Charles and featuring clips and photographs of musicians of the last century, Eastwood’s journey is sure to inspire a new generation as he asks “Who were your influences…?” Whilst guitar seems to take centre stage in modern blues, it could be argued that it was piano that lead to the popularisation of the form with hit makers such as Ray Charles, Fats Domino and Duke Ellington leading the way. Refreshingly includes some footage and interviews with female musicians. Some of the legends seen performing are: Ray Charles, Dr. John, Fats Domino, Prof. Longhair, Nat King Cole, Dave Brubeck, Marcia Ball, Jay McShann, Art Tatum, Big Joe Turner and Duke Ellington among many others.

results.title: Small pebbles on a giant shore
results.creator_credit: Maria Stratford and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Describes problems of disabled non-English speaking immigrants in Australia. Shows how some of these special groups have received assistance through the help of ADEC (Action on Disability within Ethnic Communities).

results.title: The Boy who turned off
results.creator_credit: Larry Kurnarsky, Michael Scott, Jerry Krepakevich and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An intimate portrait of a family’s struggle to cope with an autistic son. The film examines the effects of an endless cycle of successes and failures, the frustration’s of seeking treatment for a problem that still eludes definition, and the painful uncertainty of what the future will bring. A powerful, thought-provoking film for anyone who seeks to understand autism or the disabled person’s relations with family. Award: New York
results.creator_credit_for_label: Larry Kurnarsky, Michael Scott, Jerry Krepakevich and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Try your fortune
results.creator_credit: Ziyin Wang, Barbara Mariotti and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Looks at immigration and cross cultural marriages. This program focuses on Chinese immigrants and marriages between Chinese citizens and Australians. Two Australian/Chinese couples are interviewed on aspects such as why they decided to get married, how their families felt about the marriage and how each Chinese person coped with language and monetary barriers when they first arrived in Australia. The program also looks at overseas students and why they are attracted to making Australia their permanent home. Discusses the steps Chinese spouses must take to convince the immigration department that the marriage is a ‘real’ one, and not one of convenience. Some interviews are conducted in Chinese. No subtitles are provided.

results.title: The Boy Kumasenu
results.creator_credit: Sean Graham, John Hollingsworth and Gold Coast Film Unit
results.brief_description: Dramatised documentary of a young African boy, Kumasenu, making his way unaided from the tribal world into the twentieth century. He has known no life other than that of a quiet fishing village. Wrongly accused of bringing bad luck to his people he becomes an outcast and an easy prey to the temptations of the city life of which his flash friend Agboh thinks so highly. Until helped by new friends, life for him is bewildering and dangerous.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sean Graham, John Hollingsworth and Gold Coast Film Unit

results.title: The Boxer [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Jim Sheridan, Arthur Lappin, Hell's Kitchen and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Danny Flynn (Daniel Day Lewis) has just been released from prison after serving a 14 year sentence for something he didn’t do. Returning to his old neighbourhood, he is re-united with Maggie (Emily Watson), his child hood sweetheart, whose husband is also serving time in jail for his involvement with the IRA. Maggie is desperately unhappy raising her son alone and Danny’s presence brings some light to her depressing life. Danny and Maggie become close once again, much to the anger of their fellow neighbours and friends. Wanting to do something positive with his life, Danny draws on his past experience as a successful boxer and transforms the local community centre into a gym where he can teach the local children boxing. After a bomb goes off at the centre, Danny and Maggie are forced to make a decision about their future. Directed by Jim Sheridan (“In the name of the father”), “The Boxer” shows us the personal impact of Ireland’s political troubles. Also available on VHS [318846].
